Header: UK PM Johnson says important to enforce terrorism sentences after London Bridge attack
Content: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said, it was important to enforce terrorism-related sentences, as The Times newspaper reported that a London knife attacker had been convicted of an “Islamist terrorism-related offence” and released from prison about a year ago. Johnson, who has called a snap election for December 12 and is due to host NATO leaders including U.S. President Donald Trump next week, praised those who took on the man for their courage and said Britain would never be cowed.
